actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Public Assistance and Unemployment Compensation.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Assistance and Unemployment Compensation

official_title: A bill to amend part A of title IV of the Social Security Act to reduce from six to three the maximum age of a child on account of whom a mother or other caretaker relative receiving aid to families with dependent children may claim an exemption from registration under the WIN program.

summary.text: Amends part A (Aid to Families with Dependent Children) of title IV of the Social Security Act to reduce from six to three the age of a child at which the mother or other caretaker relative must register for the Work Incentive Program (part C of title Iv) in order to be eligible for AFDC.

titles.title: A bill to amend part A of title IV of the Social Security Act to reduce from six to three the maximum age of a child on account of whom a mother or other caretaker relative receiving aid to families with dependent children may claim an exemption from registration under the WIN program.
